transcript.title: NATIONAL MEETING ON YOUTH TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT WEDNESDAY, JULY 22, 1992
transcript.content:
NATIONAL MEETING ON YOUTH TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT
WEDNESDAY, JULY 22, 1992
AGENDA AND LIST OF PARTICIPANTS
This meeting is being structured to allow as much time as
possible for open discussion.
10. O0am: opening session, introductory remarks
* This session is open to media
Prime Minister
Representative from Australian Youth Policy and
Action Coalition ( AYPAC)
ACTU Eric Mayer, Chairman of Business in the Community
for Young People
lO. O0am 12. l5pm: Reform of Vocational Education and
Entry Level Training
* This session is not open to media
Minister for Employment, Education and Training
Laurie Carmichael, Chairman of Employment and Skills
Formation Council
Premier of Victoria
Bill Mansfield, ACTU
John Prescott, Managing Director, BHP
Discussion
12. l5pm 1.30pm
Luncheon

1.30pm 3.45pm: Training and Employment initiatives to
address the immediate problem of youth unemployment
* This session is not open to media
Prime Minister
S Paul Turley, AYPAC
Merle Mitchell, President, Australian Council of
Social Services
S John Bell, Chief Executive, Esprit Australia Pty Ltd
S Discussion
3.45pm: Closing remarks by Prime Minister
This is a draft schedule. Times are as accurate as can be
predicted but may vary slightly as discussions continue.
July 21, 1992

NAT7IONAL MEETING ON YOUTH TRAINING AND
EMPLOYMENT
Parliament House, Canberra
Wednesday 22 July 1992
